title: Drawing programs?
body: Hey Riot this is a message for you guys, I was wondering after seeing the picture for the gankplank roundtable post, what kind of program do you guys use to draw the champs? How many people are on your team that designs the characters? not kit just the way they look. and How often do you guys practice drawing champs and just your own little creations? I'm kind of interested in the Graphic Design field. And i also just wanted to know how you guys go about some things.

replies.body:
Hey Kazuto Ishin,

- Most artists use Adobe Photoshop for general illustration, but I also see people using Sketchbook Pro and Corel Painter. 3D programs like Sketchup, Maya, 3DStudio Max and ZBrush are also used from time to time for creating geometry in perspective and proxy models.

- There is a team that develop new champions and a team that update existing champions, I don't know the exact numbers on those teams but they have at least a few concept artists.

- Something common of all successful artists is that we practice all the time. We draw because we love drawing. There is a sketch group on Wednesday nights were we all jam on random themes, Thursday nights some of us do life-drawing, Friday afternoon impromptu drawing outside etc. We also spend a lot of time giving each other craft feedback and learning by asking questions of all the people around us. I like hanging out with the splash artists and just quietly watching them work.

Let me know if you have any more specific questions >:)

Thank you for responding to this.

 Just a question i thought of for you, what is the biggest design project you had to work on for league, and how long did it take?
I contributed to DJ Sona (at the same time as other projects) for about 6 months, the whole project start-to-launch took over a year!
